name: Jiarong Wu (邬佳蓉)
bio: Jiarong grew up in Nanchang, China, and completed her B.Sc. in Chemistry at Wuhan University in 2021, working under Dr. Haibo Zhang on boron-cluster photocatalysis. In 2022, she earned an MRes in Nanomaterials (Distinction) from Imperial College London, supervised by Dr. Becky Greenaway and Prof. Kim Jelfs, with a thesis on experimental realization of computationally-predicted porous organic cages. Later that year, she began her PhD at the University of Würzburg under Dr. Jake Greenfield and Prof. Frank Würthner, focusing on photoswitchable imines and their use to drive molecular systems out of equilibrium.
education: PhD Student, University of Würzburg (Oct 2022 – Present)
Imperial College London (MRes in Nanomaterials, Distinction, 2022)
awards: RSC Travel Grant for ISMSC 2024 (Hangzhou, CN)
Highlighted as a Rising Star in Supramolecular Chemistry, 2024
